Description: Copper blade of a battle-axe: the butt is straight and the sides turn out sharply at the cutting end to form two distinct cusps. Unusually, the blade has a mid-rib. The sides are bevelled. The blade has been cleaned of corrosion product. One face is smoother than the other. There is a small casting fault beneath one of the lugs. The cutting edge is sharp and shows distinct signs of wear.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 127, pl. LXVI, 9; E. Kühnert-Eggesbrecht, ‘Die Axt als Waffe und Werkzeug im alten Ägypten’ (Berlin, 1969), 109, G-III/I, pl. XII, 5; 'Pharaonen und Fremde : Dynastien im Dunkel' [exhibition catalogue] (Vienna, 1994), no. 304.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (106)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1994 7 Sep-26 Oct, Austria, Vienna, Museen der Stadt Wien, Pharanen und Fremde
